newsitem.title: USA: Wolverine World Wide momentum continues into Q1.
newsitem.headline: Wolverine World Wide momentum continues into Q1.

text.p: Wolverine World Wide Inc said Monday the sales and earnings momentum established in late 1996 has continued into 1997 with strong gains in quarterly results.

The company said net income in the period ended March 22 reached $4.7 million, or $0.16 a share, versus $3.4 million, or $0.12, a year ago. Sales climbed to $129.3 million from $83.8 million in the same period last year, Wolverine said.
The company said order rates during the quarter for its domestic business were more than 40 percent higher than 1996 levels, and order backlog was 30 percent higher.
Wolverine makes and markets branded and leather footwear.
Its shares closed up one Monday at 36-5/8.
